explains: adj. 出生在美国的；原件第一代

sentences.en: First-generation Americans view the United States as a land of golden opportunity.
sentences.cn: 第一代美国人把美国看成一个充满良机的大陆。

sentences.en: Chelsea Jones, who now directs student programming at I'm First, was a first-generation college student at Howard.
sentences.cn: 切尔西·琼斯目前在 I'm First 指导学生编程，她是霍华德大学第一代大学生。

sentences.en: Nijay represents a large and growing group of Americans: first-generation college students who enter school unprepared or behind.
sentences.cn: Nijay 代表了一个庞大、且在不断壮大的美国人群体：入学时毫无准备或相对落后的第一代大学生。
